title: Solving the Antiderivative
text: We have $$\frac{d}{dx} sin\left(x\right)=cos(x)$$. Thus, $$F(x)=sinx$$ is an antiderivative of cos $$x$$.
speech: We have  fraction, d over, d x,  sine of x is equal to, cosine of x . Thus,    f of x is equal to sinx  is an antiderivative of cos  x .
pacedSpeech: We have   fraction, d over, d x,  sine of x is equal to, cosine of x
. Thus,     f of x is equal to sinx
is an antiderivative of cos   x
